item.title: UNIX: A History and a Memoir [Notes]
item.description: Highlights: Concentration of talent, freedom to work on what was interesting, long term thinking, collegiality, cross-disciplinary, frequent communication between members, lots of money and stable funding. Bell Labs was basically a playground for computer nerds. They had Management that understood the need for researcher independence because they themselves had been technical researchers. Stable funding because they were supported by a nationwide monopoly. Stable funding was a crucial factor for research.
